alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lakeshore Flood Warning issued March 03 at 3:45PM EST until March 04 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding. * WHERE...Monroe County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads closed and low lying property including parking lots, lawns, and homes and businesses will be inundated near the lake. Some shoreline erosion will occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East to northeast gales of around 35 knots with gusts to 40 knots at times and waves of 6 to 8 feet are anticipated in the western basin of Lake Erie through this evening. As a result, water levels at Toledo are expected to rise above 72 inches above low water datum during that time. For Monroe County, the greatest water level rises and chance for lakeshore flooding will be in the southeastern portion of the county. However, lakeshore flooding will still be possible along all shoreline areas of the county.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
